Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Saloon Intrigue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town, the initial characters, and the central conflict concerning the town's fate and romantic tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Comic and Character Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to the comic title, setting, and initial character interactions in a saloon.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town's Impending Demise
sub_scenes.description: Transition to Ghost Town and the revelation of plans to demolish it for an airport, causing emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Exit and Ghost Town Ride
Ghost Town's Past and Airport Future
Emotional Argument about Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Family Conflict and Nan's Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's family issues, her relationship with Cal, and her emotional turmoil amidst business and personal conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Business Tensions and Family Argument
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of business discussions related to the airport, leading to family tension and an argument between Nan and her father.

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Guidance and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives comfort and advice from her mother and maid, leading to her resolve to seek answers from Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Maid's Pragmatic View on Love and Action

sub_scenes.title: Horseback Confrontation and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal, leading to a conversation about their relationship and a hesitant reconciliation before a new crisis emerges.

Major_Arcs.title: The Snowstorm Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the onset and impact of a severe snowstorm, the community's reaction, and their fight for survival against the elements.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Weather Warning
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile amidst growing concerns about the unprecedented severity of the approaching snowstorm.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and Understanding
Mr. Wills and Son Assess the Snowstorm's Severity

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Weather Threat and Community Fear
sub_scenes.description: The community grapples with the dire situation as the snowstorm intensifies, threatening livestock and their livelihood.

narrative_arcs.title: Grave Concerns about Livestock and Fodder
Confirmation of the Weather's Unprecedented Danger
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst Hardship
Cal's Ominous Reflection on Impending Starvation and Future Uncertainty
Nan's Doubt and Cal's Reassurance in the Face of Crisis
Nan's Mother's Plea for Rest and Hope Amidst Overwhelming Odds
Cal's Restless Night and the Unrelenting Snow
Despair and Weariness in the Face of Endless Winter
Sound of an Airplane and a Glimmer of Hope
Excitement and Realization of Fodder Drop
Conversation on Romance Amidst Crisis and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova: The Brawl and Jeff's Troubles
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and the 'Cowtown Casanova' storyline, focusing on a town brawl, reactions to Chane, and concerns surrounding Jeff's behavior.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Chane Benson through a town brawl and the varied reactions of townspeople to his actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and a Town Scene
Reactions and Judgments of Bystanders on Chane Benson's Actions
Further Reactions and Cynical Commentary on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gunplay and Mother's Concern
sub_scenes.description: Focus shifts to Jeff, his fascination with guns, and his mother's deep-seated concerns about his behavior and admiration for figures like Chane Benson and Clyde Surrett.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Flashback and Concerns About Jeff

sub_scenes.title: Contrasting Masculinities and Sally's Worry
sub_scenes.description: Juxtaposition of Clyde and Chane's macho banter against the mother's moral framework, followed by Sally's escalating worry about Jeff and her plea for help from Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Macho Banter and Violent Undertones between Clyde and Chane
Clyde's Affectionate Agreement and Future Vision
Narrator's Observation of Jeff's Absence and Town Ride
Sally Seeks Advice from Mr. Benson
Mr. Benson's Advice on Violence and Youth

Major_Arcs.title: The Newspaper Article and Juniper Confrontations
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the fallout from a newspaper article, leading to confrontations, misunderstandings, and escalating tensions in Juniper.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Immediate Impact and Sally's Fury
sub_scenes.description: Sally reacts with outrage to a newspaper article and seeks Benson's guidance after Clyde dismisses her concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Outrage Over the Article and Initial Talk with Benson
Sally Confronts Clyde, the Editor, About the Article
Clyde's Dismissive Reaction and Sally's Criticism
Sally Seeks Benson's Guidance in Juniper

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Plan and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Benson formulates a plan to address the article's impact, and Jeff proposes inviting Chane Benson to dinner, leading to escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Reaction to the Article and Speculation on Clyde's Response
Considering Dinner with Chane and Reflecting on His Character
Post-Dinner Moonlight Conversation and Rising Tension
Immediate Aftermath and Explanations Following the Forced Kiss
Realization of Danger to Clyde and Urgent Need to Go to Town
Jeff's Determined Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation in Town and Jeff's Intervention
Escalating Tensions and a Challenge to a Fistfight
Anxious Wait in the Clarion Office
Recounting the Night's Events and Newspaper Priority
Praise for Jeff and Clyde's Character and Family Values

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Rivalry and Betsy's Love Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and characters, focusing on ranch conflicts, Betsy's leadership, and her burgeoning romance with Steve amidst range war fears.

sub_scenes.title: New Boss and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss and escalating ranch troubles hint at a potential range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the New Boss, Steve Daley
Settling Steve In and Past Doubts
Ranch Troubles and Range War Fear

sub_scenes.title: Trip to Town and Bridges Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's trip to town leads to a confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, escalating ranch tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Romantic Awakening and Conflict with Steve
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reconsiders firing Hank, realizes her feelings for Steve, and confronts Steve about his violent nature, leading to a love confession.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: New conflicts arise as Old Man Bridges complains and Hank confronts Steve, leading to Betsy and Steve facing critical decisions.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Hank and Steve's Defense
Justification for Arms and Recall of Ambush
Betsy's Narration of Pursuit and Arrival at Devil's Pass
Confrontation and Capture at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova: Carrie and Fred's Business and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Carrie and Fred's storyline, focusing on their romantic and business entanglements, and the deception surrounding the Carlton contract.

sub_scenes.title: Dave, Carrie, and Curley's Trouble
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to Carrie and Dave's interactions and the emergence of trouble with Curley and fence disputes.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Behavior and Ranch Concerns

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation, Differing Opinions, and Ominous Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave reconcile temporarily, discuss Fred, and Carrie has an unsettling encounter with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Fred and Differing Opinions
Agreement to Avoid Conflict and Carrie's Reflection
Encounter with Fred Gordon and Ominous Question
Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon's Conversation about Dave's Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Deception, Fury, and Confrontation with Fred
sub_scenes.description: Carrie discovers Fred's deception regarding the Carlton contract, leading to a furious confrontation and a visit to Carlton's office.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Assertions in Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Rejection, Buckboard Ride, and Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie rejects Fred and Dave, recalls past wisdom from her father, and finally learns the truth about Fred's brother's actions regarding the contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Pride and Present Hurt with Fred
Unexpected Encounter and Cold Dismissal in Town
Concern and Defiance in the Buckboard
Father and Dave's Clarification & Carlton's Interjection
Dave's Confession and Carrie's Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova: Chris and Rance's Dangerous Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Chris and Rance's tumultuous love story, marked by danger, deception, and a final resolution amidst violence and escape.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives injured at Chris's door, seeking help and revealing he has been shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Late Night Visitor and Urgent Plea

sub_scenes.title: Family Concern and Marshal's Inquiry
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's family reacts to his gunfight history, while the Marshal arrives at Chris's ranch to investigate the killing.

narrative_arcs.title: Worried Kin and a Father's Decision
Plea for Mercy and a Change of Plans
Duty vs. Love and a Hint of Escape
Decision to Act and Arming Dirk
